notes.text:
An update for libtiff is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The libtiff packages contain a library of functions for manipulating Tagged Image File Format (TIFF) files.

Security Fix(es):

* LibTiff: DoS from Divide By Zero Error (CVE-2022-2056, CVE-2022-2057, CVE-2022-2058)

* libtiff: Double free or corruption in rotateImage() function at tiffcrop.c (CVE-2022-2519)

* libtiff: uint32_t underflow leads to out of bounds read and write in tiffcrop.c (CVE-2022-2867)

* libtiff: tiffcrop.c has uint32_t underflow which leads to out of bounds read and write in extractContigSamples8bits() (CVE-2022-2869)

* libtiff: tiffcrop: heap-buffer-overflow in extractImageSection in tiffcrop.c (CVE-2022-2953)

* libtiff: Assertion fail in rotateImage() function at tiffcrop.c (CVE-2022-2520)

* libtiff: Invalid pointer free operation in TIFFClose() at tif_close.c (CVE-2022-2521)

* libtiff: Invalid crop_width and/or crop_length could cause an out-of-bounds read in reverseSamples16bits() (CVE-2022-2868)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A divide-by-zero vulnerability was found in libtiff. This flaw allows an attacker to cause a denial of service via a crafted tiff file.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libtiff: division by zero issues in tiffcrop
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running applications linked against libtiff must be restarted for this update to take effect.

notes.text: A double-free flaw was found in the tiffcrop tool distributed with the libtiff tools package. The double-free issue leads to a denial of service, impacting the availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libtiff: Double free or corruption in rotateImage() function at tiffcrop.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running applications linked against libtiff must be restarted for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: libtiff: Double free or corruption in rotateImage() function at tiffcrop.c

notes.text: A flaw was found in libtiff 4.4.0rc1. There is a sysmalloc assertion fail in rotateImage() at tiffcrop.c:8621 that can cause program crash when reading a crafted input.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

All running applications linked against libtiff must be restarted for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: libtiff: Assertion fail in rotateImage() function at tiffcrop.c

cwe.name: Release of Invalid Pointer or Reference

notes.text: It was found in libtiff 4.4.0rc1 that there is an invalid pointer free operation in TIFFClose() at tif_close.c:131 called by tiffcrop.c:2522 that can cause a program crash and denial of service while processing crafted input.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libtiff: Invalid pointer free operation in TIFFClose() at tif_close.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running applications linked against libtiff must be restarted for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: libtiff: Invalid pointer free operation in TIFFClose() at tif_close.c

notes.text: A flaw was found in libtiff's tiffcrop utility that has a uint32_t underflow that can lead to an out-of-bounds read and write. This flaw allows an attacker who supplies a crafted file to tiffcrop (likely via tricking a user to run tiffcrop on it with certain parameters)to cause a crash or, in some cases, further exploitation.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libtiff: uint32_t underflow leads to out of bounds read and write in tiffcrop.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This flaw has been rated as a Moderate because it is present in the tiffcrop utility rather than the libtiff library itself.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running applications linked against libtiff must be restarted for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: libtiff: uint32_t underflow leads to out of bounds read and write in tiffcrop.c

cwe.name: Improper Validation of Specified Quantity in Input

notes.text: An improper input validation flaw was found in libtiff's tiffcrop utility. This issue can lead to an out-of-bounds read and cause a crash if an attacker can supply a crafted file to tiffcrop.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libtiff: Invalid crop_width and/or crop_length could cause an out-of-bounds read in reverseSamples16bits()
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This flaw is present in the tiffcrop tool only and not in the libtiff library code.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running applications linked against libtiff must be restarted for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: libtiff: Invalid crop_width and/or crop_length could cause an out-of-bounds read in reverseSamples16bits()

notes.text: A flaw was found in libtiff's tiffcrop tool that has a uint32_t underflow, which leads to an out-of-bounds read and write in the extractContigSamples8bits routine. This flaw allows an attacker who supplies a crafted file to tiffcrop to trick a user into opening the crafted file with tiffcrop, causing a crash or potential further exploitations.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libtiff: tiffcrop.c has uint32_t underflow which leads to out of bounds read and write in extractContigSamples8bits()
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This flaw is present only in the tiffcrop tool, not in the libtiff library code.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running applications linked against libtiff must be restarted for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: libtiff: tiffcrop.c has uint32_t underflow which leads to out of bounds read and write in extractContigSamples8bits()

notes.text: An out-of-bound read flaw was found in LibTIFF, in extractImageSection in the tools/tiffcrop.c:6905, allowing attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted tiff file.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libtiff: tiffcrop: heap-buffer-overflow in extractImageSection in tiffcrop.c
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running applications linked against libtiff must be restarted for this update to take effect.
